author: host
title: Discovery Park and Lighthouse Loop Trail
description: Enjoy this 4.4-mile loop trail near Seattle, Washington. Generally considered an easy route, it takes an average of 1 h 45 min to complete.
content: Really beautiful trail, not that many people on it in the morning but it was 30 degrees so there might be more people when it’s warmer. Highly recommend bringing sunglasses because the sun reflects off the water after the lighthouse so it is hard to see and you definitely don’t want to miss those beautiful sights

author: host
title: Green Lake Trail
description: Enjoy this 2.9-mile loop trail near Seattle, Washington. Generally considered an easy route, it takes an average of 51 min to complete.
content: Went to Seattle, stopped by Green Lake. A very nice walk in the morning. This is a busy park, parking at the designated trailhead is limited. I parked at nearby street. The trail is flat, paved, and good for everyone. Short video: https://youtu.be/jkbwvwV5o_s

author: host
title: The Washington Park Arboretum
description: Enjoy this 1.5-mile loop trail near Seattle, Washington. Generally considered an easy route, it takes an average of 30 min to complete.
content: Trail from Shelby/Hamlin to Foster Island is still OK but getting damp. Will be muddy after more rain. Very pretty through Marsh Island now! Connection to Arboretum is open currently. Trail under the Montlake bridge is an interesting add on. Arboretum is fascinating, even in the late fall!

author: host
title: Seward Park Perimeter Trail
description: Head out on this 2.4-mile loop trail near Seattle, Washington. Generally considered an easy route, it takes an average of 43 min to complete.
content: This is a great trail for a quick walk or run. It’s paved and flat, so it’s easy to get a good workout in. The trail is well maintained and there are plenty of benches along the way to rest. There are also a few places to get water along the way. The trail is also dog friendly, so you can bring your pup along for the walk. I would recommend this trail for anyone looking for a quick walk or run.

author: host
title: Loop Trail via West Emerson Street
description: Enjoy this 1.5-mile loop trail near Seattle, Washington. Generally considered an easy route, it takes an average of 30 min to complete.
content: Well maintained trail. Very easy to complete the whole thing! There are plenty of signs along the trail so it’s easy to find the right route (there are multiple intersections and it tends to confuse me because I’m not very good at directions).

author: host
title: Lake Union Loop Trail
description: Enjoy this 6.4-mile loop trail near Seattle, Washington. Generally considered an easy route, it takes an average of 2h 3min to complete.
content: Mostly flat. There are good views of the lake and city along the way. It is also fun to check Gasworks park. Parts of the trail go past alleyways and homeless camps. Would recommend doing this loop during sunlight.

author: host
title: Cable Lin Trail to West Tiger Mountain
description: Enjoy this 3.0-mile loop trail near Seattle, Washington. Generally considered an easy route, it takes an average of 2h 58 min to complete.
content: Parking wasn’t a problem at all. Beginning of the trail was in the shade and the ground was frosty, not slippery though. Snow was on the ground near the top, after the West Tiger #3 sign. We had micro spikes but didn’t need them. Trekking poles are highly recommended for descent as these loose rocks and wet wood pieces are slippery.

author: host
title: Lake Washington Boulevard Trail
description: Enjoy this 2.4-mile loop trail near Seattle, Washington. Generally considered an easy route, it takes an average of 43 min to complete.
content: Easy path, lots of birdsong. Saw lots of different birds including ducks; also rabbits, squirrels, and snakes! Definitely some spots away from traffic noise, but few spots not within earshot of a couple of roosters experiencing existential crises. Overall a nice stretch of the legs.
